passage_text: Donna holds the record for retaining major hurricane status (category 3 or greater on the Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Scale) in the Atlantic Basin for the longest period of time on record. For nine days, September 2 to September 11, Donna consistently had sustained winds of at least 115 mph.

It’s anyone’s guess where Irene could stack up against past storms in Maryland. Here’s a list of the most impactful hurricanes and storms in Maryland since 1960 Major hurricanes and storms in Maryland since 1960: 1960 – Hurricane Donna, winds 100 mph in Ocean City, two deaths. 1961 – Hurricane Esther, winds 45 mph in Ocean City.

1 Hurricane Donna is the only hurricane on record to produce hurricane-force winds in Florida, the Mid-Atlantic States, and New England (Sombrero Key, FL: 206 km/h [128 mph] sustained winds; Elizabeth City, NC: 133.6 km/h [83 mph] sustained winds; Block Island, RI: 152.9 km/h [95 mph] sustained winds).

Fast Facts: 1  Hurricane Donna is the only hurricane on record to produce hurricane-force winds in Florida, the Mid-Atlantic States, and New England (Sombrero Key, FL: 206 km/h [128 mph] sustained winds; Elizabeth City, NC: 133.6 km/h [83 mph] sustained winds; Block Island, RI: 152.9 km/h [95 mph] sustained winds).

Track of Hurricane Donna. Hurricane Donna caused a storm surge of up to 4 m (13 ft) in the Florida Keys, 3.4 m (11 ft) along the SW coast of Florida, 1.8–2.4 m (4-8 ft) in North Carolina, and a 1.5-3 m (5-10 ft) surge along the New England coast.

If you’ve lived in Maryland for a while, you’ve been there before. 1  1960 – Hurricane Donna, winds 100 mph in Ocean City, two deaths. 2  1961 – Hurricane Esther, winds 45 mph in Ocean City. 3  1964 – Tropical Storm Cleo, 5.8 inches of rain in Westernport (Allegany County).

Hurricane Donna holds the record for keeping major hurricane status in the Atlantic Basin for the longest period of time. For nine days, September 2 to September 11, Donna had maximum sustained winds of at least 115 mph (185 km/h). Hurricane Donna was a very destructive hurricane.
